ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to think about landscape in many different ways. I learned new things about some good filmmakers. I developed the ability to write critically about theoretical texts.

This is a truly special interdisciplinary exploration of landscape through art, architecture, film, and literature. I learned to understand the built and natural landscape in new ways, and strengthened my comparative skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very interesting class materials, discussions and lecture content. Sometimes a lack of clear guidance for improvement upon essay responses.

Strengths: Fatima, wide array of source material that can't be read or watched in any other course at Yale, mixture of architecture school grad students, German PhD candidates, and undergrads
Weaknesses: sometimes disorganized, some weeks didn't have a coherent theme

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would as a good taste of how Film classes work at Yale. It's good to look at film through a narrow lens like landscape.

Yes! The topics are vast but interesting. I would recommend this class especially to students with prior exposure to readings and materials across disciplines like film, architecture and German Studies.

Yes! This is a one-of-a-kind course at Yale. Fatima is an incredible instructor, and the texts we looked at were totally new and transformative to me The architecture school students brought valuable perspective, and I hope I did the same for them.
